1.title: A Tribute: Thelonius Monk
1.plot: A tribute to Thelonious "Monk Blue", "Round Midnight", "Epistrophy", Monk Town Hall Carnegie Hall New England Symphony Encore artists India Arie John Coltrane Buddy Powell Max Roach Jerome Robbins New York City Ballet Caryl Churchill 's "Drunk Enough to Say I Love You", theatre jazz music artists Harlem Apollo Theatre Minton's Playhouse Stride --hand Kenny Clark, Dizzy Gillespie, Charlie Parker, Max Roach, Blue Note, Count Basie, Art Blakely, Kenny Dorham, Lou Donaldson, Lucky Thompson, New England Symphonies Ensemble.

2.title: A Cultural Nexus
2.plot: Gregory's monthly update of acting, art and cultural activities and entertainment. A cultural nexus for those who are passionate about art, community, people.

3.title: Holiday Fun and Travels
3.plot: December updates of a busy actor/artist's life in NYC. Holiday fun and travels as well as entertainment updates and images. Pittsburgh art galleries, Rockefeller Christmas tree lighting ceremony. A Problem From Hell by Samantha Powers, a history of genocide. Africa Zimbabwe.

4.title: The Art of Pittsburgh and Breakfast with Mugabe
4.plot: Gregory Mikell's On The town series for January Host Talk show updates, Pittsburgh "Breakfast With Mugabe" show photos theatre in the round Intro Music: World

5.title: The Hill District and August Wilson
5.plot: Gregory Mikell artists updates for "On The Town" in Pittsburgh The Hill District August Wilson Andy Warhol exhibits Pittsburgh Post Gazette Galleries The Mattress Factory William Anastasi Bill Woodrow Shop of Fools Allan Wexler Lowry Burgess Plastic Poetics Regina Gouger Miller Gallery.

6.title: Broadway, Tourism and Politics

7.title: Broadway and Back Again
7.plot: Gregory Mikell an update on the artists activities, entertainment, and Politics, recommended reading, plays, music and film. Broadway, Off-Broadway The Alchemist, The39 Steps, The Castle, Jazz At Lincoln Center, the SFJazz Collective, Coltrane, Herbie Hancock, Thelonious Monk, Alto Sax player, Miguel Zenon (Zin-yon), on Tenor Sax, Joe Lovano, Trumpet, Dave Douglas, and Trombone, Robin Eubanks, Alfred Hitchcocks 1935 film, The Fortune Society, is CHERRY SMOKE by James McManus, watched the film, Chasing Freedom, DEAN KOONTZ' THE GOOD GUY, play, CHERRY SMOKE by James ...

8.title: Back to the Best
8.plot: Recommended Broadway, Off-Broadway theatre, play readings, music events, cinema, opera, ballet, concerts of Carnegie Hall, Lincoln Center performances and other current events of note.

9.title: Concerto in City Major
9.plot: An online entertainment talk show that critiques various events and venues in the entertainment industry including theatre, film, ballet, opera, concerts, galleries, exhibits, live performances.

10.title: Concerto in City Minor
10.plot: Gregory shares his experience of recent music events of Manhattan's spring season from New Orleans Jazz to classical guitar of a renowned Belgium master artist.
